Undergraduate Course Guide School of Computing

With a vision to groom industry ready professionals, IIT - the premier private sector higher education establishment opened its doors in 1990. Over the last 32 years, IIT has built a reputation for high quality teaching by offering industry demanded degree programmes with its partner universities. Our focus on academic excellence and countless opportunities for extra-curricular activities and skills development has resulted in many of our graduates achieving success in their careers. Our alumni of over 5000 graduates have amazed and inspired us with their achievements at IIT and beyond.

BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

The BEng (Hons) Software Engineering embodies the best ways to design, implement, evaluate and maintain software systems. It makes use of many of the technical aspects of computer science, especially programming and aims to develop the professional attitudes, interpersonal and technical skills you will need in the software engineering industry.

Course Overview - BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

The course provides a solid foundation in software engineering theories and practices to develop enterprise level software systems. It provides career pathways in software engineering, web application development, mobile application development, analysis and design of software systems etc.

Course Content Outline - BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

The course covers software development process models, programming languages, technologies and tools including object-oriented programming languages, OO analysis and design techniques, database designing and practice, mobile application development, web application development, security and forensics etc. Students will have the option of transferring to Level 5 of the BSc (Hons) Computer Science degree upon completion of the first year.

Course Modules - BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Trends in Computer Science, Computer Systems Fundamentals, Software Development I, Web Design and Development, Mathematics for Computing, Software Development II. Award of Certificate of Higher Education available.

Year 02 - Core Modules:
Object Oriented Programming, Database Systems, Software Development Group Project, Software Engineering Principles and Practice, Algorithms: Theory, Design and Implementation.
Optional Modules:
Mobile Application Development, Server-side Web Development, Operating Systems Programming, Robotic Principles, Business Analytics, Machine Learning and Data Mining. Award of Diploma of Higher Education available.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement:
A 12 month placement period is compulsory. This gives additional practical skills and a competitive edge.

Year 04 - Core Modules:
Final Year Project, Formal Methods, Cyber-Security, Concurrent Programming.
Optional Modules:
Advanced Server-side Web Programming, Applied Robotics, Advanced Analytics, Mobile Native Application Development, Internet of Things, Operational Research and Optimisation.

Associated Careers - BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

Software Engineer, Web Application Programmer, Software Designer/Analyst, Website Designer/Programmer, Senior Team Leader, or further study/research.

Duration - BEng (Hons) Software Engineering

4 Years (Full Time)

BSc (Hons) Computer Science

BSc (Hons) Computer Science provides a solid foundation and training regarding the fundamentals of the computer science field, along with the opportunity to specialize in Mobile and Web Computing, Games and Computer Graphics Development or Multimedia Computing disciplines.

Course Overview - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

This degree gives the right computing skills and knowledge to mold the future of businesses and organisations. It covers areas of computer science & software development.

Course Content Outline - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

Students can customize their pathway in computing areas such as systems analysis & design, mobile/web app development, games/multimedia development, user interface development, network security, and more.

Course Modules - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Trends in Computer Science, Computer Systems Fundamentals, Software Development I, Web Design and Development, Mathematics for Computing, Software Development II. (Award of Certificate of Higher Education available)

Year 02 - Core Modules:
Object Oriented Programming, Client-Server Architectures, Software Development Group Project (work based module), Database Systems. (Award of Diploma of Higher Education available)

Optional Modules:
Mobile & Web Computing Pathway: Mobile App Development, Server-side Web Development, Advanced Client-side Development.
Usability and Interaction Theme: HCI & UX, XR & Multimodal Interaction, 3D Interactive Media Development.
Computer Engineering Theme: Robotic Principles, Sensors & Interfaces, Algorithms.
BIS Theme: Information Technology Security.
Data Science Theme: Machine Learning and Data Mining.
Games & Computer Graphics Development Pathway: Maths and Physics for Games, Game Engine Architecture, XR Multimodal Interaction.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

A compulsory 12-month industrial placement between years 2 and 4. Gives additional practical skills and a competitive edge in the job market. IIT students often selected for high-income employment.

Year 04 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

Final Year Project, Cyber Security, Applied AI.
Optional Modules - Depending on pathway:
Mobile & Web Computing: Mobile Native App Development, Advanced Server-side Web Programming.
Usability and Interaction: Usability Testing, Digital Marketing, Advanced Interactive Media.
BIS Theme: Information Driven Entrepreneurship, Strategic Management of IS.
Data Science Theme: Data Visualisation, Operational Research.
Games & Graphics Theme: Game AI, Games Networking & Security.
Computer Engineering: Internet of Things, Applied Robotics.

Associated Careers - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

Mobile App Developer, Web App Developer, Cross-Platform Developer, Mobile Security Engineer, UI/UX Engineer, Software Engineer, Computer Animation Designer, Computer Game Developer, Quality Assurance Engineer, many more.

Duration - BSc (Hons) Computer Science

4 Years (Full Time)

BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

Awarded by Robert Gordon University (RGU) in collaboration with IIT. Designed to address the rising demand for AI and Data Science professionals.

Course Overview - BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

Focus on solving real-world problems using AI/DS techniques. Strong emphasis on contemporary trends and technologies such as IoT, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Big Data.

Course Content Outline - BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

General to specialized modules structure:
Programming, Databases, Web, IoT, Algorithms, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Machine Vision, Mathematics, and Statistics. Includes strong practical exposure with a mandatory industrial placement.

Course Modules - BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Computer Systems Fundamentals, Database Systems, Web Technology, Programming Fundamentals, Computational Mathematics, Data Structures and Algorithms for AI, English Communication Skills.

Year 02 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) AI and Data Science

Artificial Intelligence, Object-Oriented Development, Advanced Mathematics for Data Science, Machine Learning, Simulation & Modelling Techniques, Data Engineering, Data Science Group Project.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement - BSc (Hons) AI and Data Science

Compulsory 12-month industry placement (credit bearing). Gives competitive advantage for employment.

Year 03 - Core Modules after placement - BSc (Hons) AI and Data Science

Core: Deep Learning.
Optional: Internet of Things and Wearables, Edge Artificial Intelligence.

Year 04 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) AI and Data Science

Individual Research Project, Research Trends, Computational Intelligence.
Optional Modules: Machine Vision, Language Processing and Information Retrieval.

Associated Careers - BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

Data/Enterprise Architect, Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Analyst, Data Science Consultant, Big Data Engineer, Software Engineer.

Duration - BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

4 Years (Full Time)

Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – IT

Designed for students who do not meet A/L entry criteria for degree programmes. Provides essential knowledge and skills for undergraduate success in IT.

Foundation Course Content Outline - IT Pathway

Core Modules: Academic Skills in Higher Education, Mathematics for Computing, Digital Skills for Higher Education, Working with Data, Essential Language Skills.
Optional Pathways:
- Software Engineering / Computer Science: Introduction to Programming, Computer Programming, Digital Circuits and Logic Design, Designing Innovative Solutions.
- AI & Data Science: Introduction to Programming, Computer Programming, Digital Circuits and Logic Design, Mathematics for Data Science.

Entry Requirements - Foundation IT

Minimum six passes at Local O/L or five passes at London O/L with three credits including English and Maths.

Academic Progression - Foundation IT

Successful students can enter Year 1 of:
- BEng (Hons) Software Engineering
- BSc (Hons) Computer Science
- BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

Duration - Foundation Certificate IT

1 Year (Full Time)

Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – Business

The Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – Business is a programme that enables students with a qualification entry gap to pursue a degree and helps students who desire to fast track their education towards an undergraduate degree.

Foundation Business Course Overview

A 1-year academic preparation to develop knowledge and skills in communication, English, Mathematics, and business essentials. Leads into Business Management, Business Information Systems, and Business Data Analytics degrees.

Foundation Course Content Outline - Business Pathway

Core Modules:
Academic Skills in Higher Education, Mathematics for Business, Digital Skills for Higher Education, Principles of Business, Essential Language Skills.

Optional Modules depending on pathways:
Business Data Analytics: Working with Data, Introduction to Programming, Mathematics for Data Science, plus Business Accounting, Introduction to Economics, Introduction to Marketing.
Business Information Systems: Working with Data, Introduction to Programming, Creative Problem Solving, plus Business Accounting, Introduction to Economics, Introduction to Marketing.
Business Management: Business Accounting, Creative Problem Solving, Critical Thinking & Analysis, plus Introduction to Economics, Introduction to Marketing.

Entry Requirements - Foundation Business

Minimum of six passes at Local GCE O/L or five passes at London GCE O/L, with at least three credits including English and Mathematics.

Academic Progression - Foundation Business

Upon completion, students may enter:
- BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems
- BA (Hons) Business Management
- BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Duration - Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – Business

1 Year (Full Time)

BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Develop skills to lead digital transformation, manage IT systems, and bridge business needs with technology. Integrates IT management skills with business process analysis and project management.

Course Overview - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

A clear perspective of how business information systems operate, develop, and support decision making and business processes. Prepares graduates for digital leadership and consultancy roles.

Course Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Database Design and Implementation, Business Computing, Business Mathematics, Web Design and Development, Requirements Modelling, Business Information Systems Concepts.

Award of Certificate of Higher Education available.

Year 02 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

BIS Design and Architecture, BIS Development, Agile Project Management and Professional Experience (work-based learning), Information Technology Security, Database Systems.

Year 02 - Optional Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Business Analytics, Server-Side Web Development.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Mandatory 12-month industry placement between Year 2 and Year 4 for enhanced employability.

Year 04 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Strategic Management of Information Systems, Information Driven Entrepreneurship & Enterprise, Business Information Systems Final Project.

Year 04 - Optional Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Customer Relationship & Change Management (CRM & CM) with Business Intelligence, Data Visualisation and Dashboarding, Big Data Analytics, Cyber Security, Digital Marketing, Social Media and Web Analytics.

Associated Careers - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

Business Analyst, Database Administrator, Information Systems Manager, IT Consultant, Project Manager, Data Analyst, Web Developer, Digital Marketer, ERP Consultant, Implementation Consultant, Product Owner.

Duration - BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems

4 Years (Full Time)

BA (Hons) Business Management

Sri Lanka’s first undergraduate Business Management degree with specialized pathways: Digital Business, Entrepreneurship, Marketing.

Course Overview - BA (Hons) Business Management

Develops strategic, entrepreneurial, and leadership skills to navigate complex business environments. Specialized pathways available in Digital Business, Marketing, and Entrepreneurship.

Course Modules - BA (Hons) Business Management

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Global Economies and the Business Environment, Analytics for Decision Making, Behaviour and Organisations, Accounting and Finance for Business, Marketing for Business Managers, Power of Brands.

Year 02 - Core Modules - BA (Hons) Business Management

Supply Chain, Operations Management and Digital Business, Management and Leadership for Business, Management Decision Making for Business, Sustainable City Economies.

Year 02 - Optional Modules - BA (Hons) Business Management

Project Management, Web-Enabled Business, Business Ethics and Corporate Social Responsibility.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement - BA (Hons) Business Management

Mandatory 12-month placement. Enhances practical skills and provides Professional Placement Project Part 1 and Part 2 modules.

Year 04 - Core Modules - BA (Hons) Business Management

Strategic Management, Contemporary Issues in Business Management, Employability and Leadership.

Year 04 - Specialized Pathways - BA (Hons) Business Management

- Digital Business: Digital Analytics, Social Media for Business.
- Marketing: Global Marketing Management, Interactive and Digital Marketing.
- Entrepreneurship: Creating Entrepreneurial Leadership, Social and Green Innovation.

Elective: Forecasting for Managers.

Associated Careers - BA (Hons) Business Management

Consultant, Corporate Branding, Digital Marketing Specialist, Brand Strategist, Event Marketer, Business Systems Consultant, Recruitment and Training, Financial Analyst, Business Analyst, Entrepreneur.

Duration - BA (Hons) Business Management

4 Years (Full Time)

BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

The modern business organization and its consumers generate vast amounts of data. Organisations use these data for business decision making and operational optimisation in many ways, leading to the emergence of Business Data Analytics.

Course Overview - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Equips students to understand how data is generated, stored, and analyzed for business decision making and optimization. Students will acquire data analytics, forecasting, data visualization, decision making, and business management skills.

Course Content Outline - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Provides a strong foundation across Business Management, Data Science, and Information Systems. Students learn theories, tools, and techniques for Business Data Analytics, enabling them to develop skills necessary for industry success.

Course Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Year 01 - Core Modules:
Business Computing, Database Design and Implementation, Business Information System Concepts, Applied Mathematics, Statistical Modelling and Analysis, Accounting and Finance for Business.

Year 02 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Database Systems, Business Analytics, Management Decision Making for Business, Data Science Project Lifecycle, Data Visualisation and Communication.

Year 02 - Optional Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Web Enabled Business, Supply Chain, Operations Management and Digital Business, Data Engineering, Machine Learning and Data Mining.

Year 03 - Industrial Placement - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

A compulsory credit-bearing 12-month placement for practical skills development.

Year 04 - Core Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Final Year Research Project, Data Visualisation and Dashboarding, Big Data Analytics.

Year 04 - Optional Modules - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Applied Artificial Intelligence, CRM & CM with Business Intelligence, Strategic Management, Digital Analytics, Forecasting for Managers, Social Media for Business, Operational Research and Optimisation.

Associated Careers - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Business Analyst, Financial Data Analyst, Consultant Analytics/Innovation, Digital Marketing Analyst, Big Data Entrepreneur.

Duration - BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics

4 Years (Full Time)

Global Recognition for IIT Graduates

University Grants Commission (UGC) Sri Lanka recognized degrees.
British Computer Society (BCS) UK accredited degrees for Software Engineering and Computer Science. Graduates are eligible for Chartered IT Professional (CITP) registration and accelerated paths to Chartered Engineer (CEng) or Incorporated Engineer (IEng) status.

Academic Progression - Foundation Certificates

After completing Foundation Certificate in IT or Business, students may progress into related undergraduate programs (BEng Software Engineering, BSc Computer Science, BSc AI & Data Science, BSc Business Information Systems, BA Business Management, BSc Business Data Analytics).

Intakes & Admission Process

IIT offers intakes in January, May, and September. Admission for local students requires an interview. International applicants apply online and complete a Skype interview.

Required Documents for Admission

Completed Application, Relevant Educational Certificates (O/Ls and A/Ls), Birth Certificate, NIC/Passport (with copies), Parent/Guardian NIC/Passport, Reference Letter (signed and stamped or letterheaded).

Postgraduate Course Guide

The Informatics Institute of Technology (IIT) was established in 1990 as the first private higher education institute that awards reputed British degrees in the field of Information Communication Technology (ICT) and Business. IIT aims to produce an exponential growth in the number of IT and business professionals within the country.

MSc Advanced Software Engineering

The MSc Advanced Software Engineering provides an education that covers in-depth specific skills and best practices available in software development while instilling important research-based skills for lifelong learning in a fast-changing technical environment.

Course Overview - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

Designed to enhance knowledge in Computer Science and Software Engineering. Focuses on practical skills in software development and theoretical grounding for further study or research. Includes critical evaluation and reflection on course material.

Entry Requirements - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

2.2 or above honours degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related disciplines with a strong programming background. Equivalent qualifications may be considered.

Course Modules - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

Core Modules:
- Advanced Software Design
- Concurrent and Distributed Systems
- Enterprise Application Development
- MSc Project

Optional Modules:
- Data Mining and Machine Learning
- Cloud Computing Applications
- Mobile Application Development
- Advanced Big Data Analytics
- Cyber Security Threats and Countermeasures
- Network Security
- IoT Technologies
- Usability and User Design Experience

Teaching and Assessment - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

Delivery through lectures, seminars, workshops. Assessments include coursework and practical work with focus on practical applications.

Associated Careers - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

Software Project Manager, Software Developer, Internet Developer, Mobile Developer, Wireless Developer, Systems Analyst, Software Engineer, Research roles.

Duration and Intakes - MSc Advanced Software Engineering

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

MSc Information Technology

A generalist Computing Master’s designed for non-computing graduates intending to enter the IT industry and graduates with limited IT background seeking cutting-edge knowledge.

Course Overview - MSc Information Technology

Aims to ensure graduates have employment prospects in IT. Students develop practical knowledge across Web & Mobile, Cybersecurity, Data Science, and E-Learning specializations.

Entry Requirements - MSc Information Technology

Minimum 2:2 lower second class honours degree from a recognized university. Applicants may be interviewed for suitability.

Course Modules - MSc Information Technology

Core Modules:
- Object Oriented Programming
- Data Structures and Algorithms
- Software Development Environments
- Data Repositories Principles and Tools
- Advanced Software Design
- Software Development Project

Optional Modules based on specialization:
Web & Mobile Pathway:
- Web Application Development
- Mobile Application Development

Cyber Security Pathway:
- Cyber Security Threats and Countermeasures
- Network Security

Data Science Pathway:
- Data Visualisation and Dashboarding
- Big Data Theory and Practice
- Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence

E-Learning Pathway:
- E-Learning Concepts & Applications

Teaching and Assessment - MSc Information Technology

Lectures, tutorials, workshops, seminars. Assessments through coursework, ICTs, exams, and practical project work.

Associated Careers - MSc Information Technology

Mobile Application Programmer, Software Developer, Software Engineer, Data Scientist, Business Analyst, Cyber Security Consultant, Technical Analyst, Lecturer/ICT Educator.

Duration and Intakes - MSc Information Technology

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

Awarded by the University of Westminster, UK. Designed with high relevance to the industry's needs. Provides highly marketable computer security and digital forensics skills.

Course Overview - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

Comprehensive introduction to Cyber Security and Digital Forensics. Covers digital evidence handling, Linux/UNIX operating systems, computer system tools, and adherence to legal guidelines. Specialization in either Cyber Security or Digital Forensics pathway.

Entry Requirements - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

A good degree in a computing-related discipline. If not from a strong computing background, work experience and other qualifications are considered. Interview required.

Course Modules - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

Core Modules:
- Cyber Security Evidence and Procedure
- Fundamentals of Security Technology
- Network Security (sometimes referred to as Internet Security)
- Research Methods
- MSc Project

Optional Modules:
Digital Forensics Pathway:
- Advanced Computer Forensics
- Computer System Tools
- Data Recovery and Analysis

Cyber Security Pathway:
- Cyber Security Applications
- Cyber Security Threats and Countermeasures
- Risk Management

Teaching and Assessment - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

Delivered through tutorials, lab-based sessions, and lectures. Practical or research-based coursework assessments by experienced academic and industry experts.

Associated Careers - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

IT Security Engineer, Cyber Security Manager, Penetration Tester (Ethical Hacker), Digital Forensics Analyst, Information Security Risk Officer, Security Operations Specialist, Vulnerability Assessor, Anti-Piracy Content Protection Analyst.

Duration and Intakes - MSc Cyber Security and Forensics

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

MA Fashion Business Management

Designed for the domestic and international fashion industry. Prepares graduates for strategic decision-making, leadership, entrepreneurship, and fashion business management.

Course Overview - MA Fashion Business Management

Explores and evaluates fashion markets, trends, and new products from a strategic perspective. Develops leadership, innovation, problem-solving skills, finance and risk management capabilities.

Entry Requirements - MA Fashion Business Management

A first or second class honours degree in any subject plus a minimum of two years' experience in fashion business or marketing. Alternatively, other qualifications or equivalent experience considered. Interview required.

Course Modules - MA Fashion Business Management

- Fashion Business Supply Chain Management
- Creative Teams and Innovation in the Fashion Business
- Strategic Fashion Business Management
- Fashion Marketing, Promotion and Brand Management
- The Fashion Business Plan and Entrepreneurship
- Fashion Business Retail Buying and Merchandising
- Research Methods
- Fashion Business Project (individual research project)

Associated Careers - MA Fashion Business Management

Graduates work globally in brands such as Aldo, Dior, Dunhill, Harrods, Hermes, Louis Vuitton, Marks & Spencer, Nordstrom, Prada, and others. Many alumni have pursued PhDs, academic research, or set up their own businesses.

Duration and Intakes - MA Fashion Business Management

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

MSc Big Data Analytics

Designed for practicing Software Engineers, Business Analysts with honours degrees in IT, Computing, or related fields. Equips students with Big Data management, analysis, visualization skills, text analytics, programming, and NoSQL data stores knowledge.

Course Overview - MSc Big Data Analytics

Offers training in Big Data technologies and methods including data mining, distributed systems programming, NoSQL databases, cloud computing platforms, and text analytics. Strong research component to prepare for industry consultancy or PhD studies.

Entry Requirements - MSc Big Data Analytics

Honours Degree (2nd class) in disciplines related to IT, Computing, Mathematics, or Statistics. Applicants usually undergo an interview. Work experience considered case by case.

Course Modules - MSc Big Data Analytics

- Advanced Databases
- Big Data Programming
- Cloud Computing
- Data Analysis
- Data Mining
- Data Warehousing
- Research Methods
- Text Analytics
- MSc Project

Teaching and Assessment - MSc Big Data Analytics

Delivered through lectures, tutorials, practicals. Coursework-based assessments. Strong emphasis on real-world Big Data application.

Associated Careers - MSc Big Data Analytics

Big Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, Big Data Systems Administrator, Data Analyst, Senior Data Engineer, Cloud Enforcement Specialist, Big Data Architect.

Duration and Intakes - MSc Big Data Analytics

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

MSc Business Analytics

Designed for practicing Business Analysts, Statisticians, Operational Managers, Data Engineers, IT Managers, and Software Engineers with an honours degree in Business, Statistics, Science, Mathematics, IT, Computing, or related areas.

Course Overview - MSc Business Analytics

Training in Business Analytics technologies and methods, including Web Mining, Business Intelligence, Big Data, Data Science, NoSQL databases, and Business Modelling techniques. Strong research focus for industry consultancy or PhD preparation.

Entry Requirements - MSc Business Analytics

Degree in IT, Business, Computing, Mathematics, or Statistics. Applicants assessed case-by-case with potential interviews. Alternative equivalent experience considered.

Course Modules - MSc Business Analytics

- Data Management
- Introduction to Big Data and Data Science
- Business Intelligence Tools and Applications
- Statistics for Business Analytics
- Business Modelling and Analytics
- Fundamentals of Data Warehousing
- Research Methods
- Web Mining
- MSc Project

Teaching and Assessment - MSc Business Analytics

Delivered through lectures, tutorials, practicals. Coursework-based assessments. Strong practical and vocational emphasis throughout the program.

Associated Careers - MSc Business Analytics

Data Warehousing Consultant, Business Analyst, Data Scientist, Business Intelligence Engineer, Report Architect, Data Miner, Business Intelligence Technical Specialist, Senior Data Engineer.

Duration and Intakes - MSc Business Analytics

Two years part-time. Intakes: January, May, September.

Documents required for Admission to Postgraduate Programs

- Completed Application Form
- Relevant Educational Certificates (First Degree / Other Relevant Qualifications)
- Birth Certificate (Original or Certified Copy)
- NIC / Passport (Original and Copy)
- Parent or Guardian NIC / Passport (Original and Copy)
- One or Two Reference Letters with Signature (Letterhead preferred; if unavailable, a company or institutional seal is required)

O/L & A/L Requirements

To apply for undergraduate programs at the Institute of Innovative Technology (IIT), students must meet the following minimum academic requirements:

For Local Ordinary Level (O/L) applicants, a minimum of six passes is required, including at least three credit passes. English Language and Mathematics are compulsory among the credit subjects. For students applying through the London O/L route, five passes with at least three credits are accepted.

For Advanced Level (A/L) qualifications, students must have completed the Local or London A/L examinations in a relevant stream. The required number of points varies depending on the degree program and subject stream. Points are calculated based on a predefined scale where an 'A' is typically valued at 10 points, 'B' at 8, 'C' at 6, and so on.

Students who do not meet the full A/L entry requirements may be eligible to enter through the Foundation program.

Stream-wise Eligibility for Computing Degrees

At the Institute of Innovative Technology (IIT), stream-wise eligibility criteria are applied to ensure students enter the most suitable degree programs based on their academic backgrounds. The entry requirements differ slightly depending on the program and the student’s A/L subject stream.

For BEng (Hons) Software Engineering or BSc (Hons) Computer Science, students from the following streams are eligible:

- Physical Science or Biological Science: Minimum of 12 points.
- Technology Stream: Students with Mathematics require 12 points. Without Mathematics, 14 points are needed.
- Commerce Stream: Eligible if IT or Business Statistics studied. Minimum 12 points; otherwise, 14 points.
- Arts Stream: Must have IT, Business Statistics, or Mathematics. Minimum requirement is 18 points.

Stream-wise Eligibility for BSc (Hons) Artificial Intelligence and Data Science

- Physical Science, Biological Science, and Technology (with Mathematics): Minimum of 12 points.
- Applicants without traditional A/L pathway may enter through an Entrance Exam.
- Entrance Exam Requirement: Minimum 50% score.

Stream-Wise Eligibility for Business Degrees

Admission to business degree programs at IIT is open to students from a variety of academic streams while maintaining standards.

For BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems:
- Physical Science, Biological Science, Commerce: 12 points minimum.
- Technology Stream: 12 points (with Mathematics) or 14 points (without Mathematics).
- Arts Stream: Must have studied IT, Business Statistics, or Mathematics. 14 points required.

For BA (Hons) Business Management:
- Students from all streams (Physical Science, Biological Science, Technology, Commerce, and Arts) are accepted with a minimum of 12 points.

For BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics:
- Physical Science, Biological Science, Technology (with Mathematics): 12 points.
- Technology Stream without Mathematics: 14 points.
- Commerce Stream: 12 points if IT or Business Statistics studied; otherwise, 14 points.
- Arts Stream: 14 points with IT, Business Statistics, or Mathematics.

General Entry Requirements for Postgraduate Programs

To be eligible for admission into postgraduate programmes at IIT, applicants must typically hold a Bachelor’s Degree with a minimum of a Second Class Lower (2:2) Honours or an equivalent qualification.

All applicants are required to attend an interview. In some cases, admission may be offered conditionally based on industry experience or alternative qualifications deemed equivalent by the academic committee.

Program-Specific Entry Requirements - Postgraduate

- MSc Advanced Software Engineering: 2:2 or above honours degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline with strong programming background.
- MSc Information Technology: 2:2 honours degree in any discipline. Open to non-IT graduates.
- MSc Cyber Security and Forensics: Good honours degree in computing-related field. Work experience considered.
- MA Fashion Business Management: First or Second Class honours degree + minimum two years work experience in fashion/marketing. Exceptional cases without degrees considered.
- MSc Big Data Analytics: Honours degree in IT, Computing, or disciplines with significant mathematics/statistics content.
- MSc Business Analytics: Degree in Business, IT, Mathematics, Statistics, or related disciplines. Alternative qualifications + work experience may be considered.

Intake Months - Undergraduate and Postgraduate Programs

Postgraduate programs and undergraduate programs at IIT are offered with three annual intakes:
- January
- May
- September

Students are encouraged to begin applications at least 2–3 months before the intended intake.

Local Students - Application Process

Local students must visit the IIT campus in Colombo for registration. Appointments should be made in advance by calling the admissions hotline (+94 766 760 760). A face-to-face interview is required.

International Students - Application Process

International applicants can apply online or via email. After submitting documents, a Skype interview will be conducted. Upon successful evaluation, a Conditional Offer Letter is issued. Visa letters are processed after receiving the registration fee and Year 1 tuition fees.

Documents Required for Admission

- Completed Application Form
- Educational Certificates (Originals or Certified Copies)
- Birth Certificate (Original or Certified Copy)
- NIC or Passport (Original and Copy)
- Reference Letters (preferably on letterhead or with an official seal)

Foundation Transfer Details

Students who do not meet the minimum A/L entry requirements can pursue university degrees by enrolling in one of IIT’s Foundation Certificate in Higher Education programs — IT pathway or Business pathway.

- Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – IT: Leads to Software Engineering, Computer Science, AI & Data Science degrees.
- Foundation Certificate in Higher Education – Business: Leads to Business Management, Business Information Systems, and Business Data Analytics degrees.

Automatic Transfer Upon Entry Failure

Students who receive a conditional offer based on pending A/L results must submit final results within five working days of release. If they fail to meet the undergraduate entry requirements, they are automatically transferred to the relevant Foundation program (IT or Business) to ensure academic continuity.

Progression to Undergraduate Degrees After Foundation

Upon successful completion of a Foundation programme, students can directly enter Year 1 of corresponding undergraduate pathways:

- For Computing Degrees: BEng (Hons) Software Engineering, BSc (Hons) Computer Science, BSc (Hons) AI & Data Science.
- For Business Degrees: BSc (Hons) Business Information Systems, BA (Hons) Business Management, BSc (Hons) Business Data Analytics.

Foundation programs also enhance academic readiness, confidence, language skills, and study techniques.

Campus Life at the Institute of Innovative Technology (IIT)

At IIT, student life goes far beyond the classroom. The institute offers a vibrant and inclusive environment where students are encouraged to explore their passions, develop leadership skills, and engage with a wide variety of extracurricular activities. Whether you’re into sports, performing arts, innovation, or global engagement — there’s something for everyone.

Student Clubs and Societies at IIT

Students participate in a variety of clubs and societies including:
- IIT Student Union
- Rotaract Club of IIT
- AIESEC in IIT
- IEEE Student Branch
- Mozilla Club
- Gaming Club
- Entrepreneurship Society
- IIT Toastmasters

These groups promote teamwork, creativity, communication, and community service, helping students grow personally and professionally.

Sports at IIT

On the sports front, IIT students actively compete in:
- Cricket

Scholarships at the Institute of Innovative Technology (IIT)

IIT is committed to recognizing and rewarding academic excellence and potential through two main scholarship schemes:

Dean’s List Scholarships (Merit-Based)

These scholarships are awarded based on outstanding academic performance in selected modules throughout the undergraduate program. After each exam board review, qualifying students will be shortlisted for an interview, which is a mandatory part of the selection process.

The Dean's List Scholarship applies to all undergraduate programs, and decisions are made based on the student's GPA, coursework, and examination outcomes. The number of scholarships offered each year is subject to availability and academic committee approval.

IIT Inforschol Program (A/L Excellence-Based)

The Inforschol Program is a prestigious scholarship initiative designed for students who achieve excellent results at the GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examinations. It offers a 100% tuition scholarship to a selected group of students.

The selection process includes:
- A competitive entrance examination testing Mathematics, English, and General IQ
- Shortlisted candidates are invited for a panel interview

Successful students will follow a 5-year structured program, where they will:
- Work full-time in a designated IT company
- Attend lectures part-time (typically in the evenings or weekends)

The program is specially designed for high-achieving individuals with strong self-discipline and time management skills.

Eligibility Criteria for Scholarships

To be eligible for either scholarship, applicants must:
- Be applying to or currently enrolled in an undergraduate program at IIT
- Demonstrate academic excellence (via A/L or university performance)
- Meet any additional requirements outlined for the specific scholarship type

Applicants for the Inforschol Program must have sat for GCE A/Ls in the most recent exam cycle and passed all subjects with excellent grades.

Interview Process for Scholarships

All scholarship candidates, whether considered for the Dean’s List or Inforschol Program, are required to attend a formal interview. The interview panel assesses:
- Academic potential and subject knowledge
- Communication skills and maturity
- Commitment to completing the program under the scholarship terms

For Inforschol applicants, performance in the entrance exam is also heavily weighted in the interview decision.

Conditions of the Scholarship

Scholarship recipients must:
- Maintain a minimum GPA as specified in the scholarship award letter
- Abide by IIT’s academic and disciplinary regulations
- Attend all scheduled lectures, labs, and exams
- Fulfill any work obligations associated with the Inforschol Program

Failure to maintain academic or behavioral standards may result in termination of the scholarship.

Local and International Eligibility for Scholarships

The Dean’s List Scholarship is available to both local and international undergraduate students.

The Inforschol Program is currently available only to local students who have sat the Sri Lankan GCE A/L exam.

International students are encouraged to apply for other internal and external financial aid schemes subject to availability.
